alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe and Lenawee Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Milan to near Britton to near Morenci. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dundee, Petersburg and Deerfield around 135 AM EDT. Ida and Maybee around 140 AM EDT. Monroe, Carleton and Temperance around 145 AM EDT. Luna Pier around 150 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Newport, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Erie, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Palmyra, Bolles Harbor, Sand Creek and Samaria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
